intro: Hieracium melachaetum, commonly known as the black devil's-bit, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually rough and hairy, and the flowers are yellow with dark centers. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in poor, sandy conditions.
